page.title: 14Housing in Ridgewood
page.content: There are two houses of particular interest. Both once belonged to the Framfield Estate. They are now privately owned. The old estate laundry is now a private home from which the owners run a video business. The cottage is surrounded by trees and is far from the road. This gives a peaceful environment which the owners think is ideal for their work. The cottage still has glass tiles in the roof where it was once used as drying rooms. What is now a display area was once the dirty linen delivery hatch. Larch Spinney comprises two converted cottages where the Masters of the Hounds once lived.The old kennels are now a garage. The cottage has been greatly extended and is named after the spinney of which only one tree remains.A 100 foot well is in the grounds plus a modern swimming pool.
